pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c08efa824a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18936/commits/c08efa824afb65c25ed2c1cf9340ea996fbc8c87)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Permanent`|647|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ permanent`
`+ permanent_diagonal`
`+ permanent_eq_elem_of_card_eq_one`
`+ permanent_eq_elem_of_subsingleton`
`+ permanent_eq_one_of_card_eq_zero`
`+ permanent_isEmpty`
`+ permanent_one`
`+ permanent_permute_cols`
`+ permanent_permute_rows`
`+ permanent_transpose`
`+ permanent_unique`
`+ permanent_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Sorry, those linter failures are my fault. VS Code strips trailing whitespace when you save, but I copy-pasted these lines without saving so there was apparently some rogue whitespace.

> Sorry, those linter failures are my fault. VS Code strips trailing whitespace when you save, but I copy-pasted these lines without saving so there was apparently some rogue whitespace.

no problem, I'll fix them...
There's also a failure in the "Post PR summary comment" workflow, this is a known issue which you can fix by merging latest master.
I'm afraid you've got an unused import somewhere
Thanks for fixing the regular-expresstion-sustitution gone wrong...
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

All looks good now, thanks!

maintainer merge

This looks pretty good to me – I've suggested some localised changes and golfs but the basic design looks just fine (modulo the impression that the empty matrix is getting more attention than it deserves).

All looks good now, thanks!

maintainer merge

```suggestion
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Permanent
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Permutation
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.PosDef
```
fixing this manually

```suggestion
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Permanent
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Permutation
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.PosDef
```
`u` is never used. You could get rid of this entirely by declaring R as `{R : Type*}`.
done, using `{R : Type*}` now.

```suggestion
* `Matrix.perm`: the permanent of a square matrix, as a sum over permutations
```

```suggestion

```
done
Is `perm` a good name? I'm a little concerned that lemmas about permanents will get mixed up with lemmas about permutations. I suggest spelling it out in full as `permanent`.
made a separate commit to changing to `permanent`. I think this is a good idea, the only reason not to do it is to have consistency with `det`, but that is probably not to important...

golfed version (no real change):
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem perm_diagonal {d : n → R} : perm (diagonal d) = ∏ i, d i := by
  refine (sum_eq_single 1 (fun σ _ hσ ↦ ?_) (fun h ↦ (h <| mem_univ _).elim)).trans ?_
  · match not_forall.mp (mt Equiv.ext hσ) with 
    | ⟨x, hx⟩ => exact Finset.prod_eq_zero (mem_univ x) (if_neg hx)
  · simp only [Perm.one_apply, diagonal_apply_eq]
```

```suggestion
theorem perm_zero [Nonempty n] : perm (0 : Matrix n n R) = 0 := by simp [perm]
```

Are permanents of empty matrices likely to come up often enough that we need _three_ lemmas specific to that case? (You're clearly following the API for determinants, but determinants are a rather more fundamental operation than permanents.)
removed `perm_isEmpty`, so now it is only two...
this line isn't needed
removed
You have `Fintype` open, but you frequently still refer to Fintype lemmas by their full name `Fintype.foo` -- you don't need to.
removed in the cases where it is not ambigous

```suggestion
/-- Permuting the columns does not change the permanent. -/
theorem perm_permute (σ : Perm n) (M : Matrix n n R) :
    (M.submatrix σ id).perm = M.perm := 
  (Group.mulLeft_bijective σ).sum_comp fun τ ↦ ∏ i : n, M (τ i) i
```
Whenever the proof argument to `sum_bijective` is `rfl`, you can use `sum_comp` instead.
Perhaps `perm_permute_left` and `perm_permute_right`, or `_rows` and `_cols`, are better than just adding a prime.
using `_cols` and `_rows` now.

```suggestion
  rw [← perm_transpose, transpose_submatrix, perm_permute, perm_transpose]
```

PS: permanents don't require negation, so:
```suggestion
variable {R : Type v} [CommSemiring R]
```
You don't need to open namespaces when you're already inside them. (Sorry, I missed this earlier.)

```suggestion
/-- The permanent of a matrix defined as a sum over all permutations -/
```
:rofl: I like the idea of "permanentutations"

(there are a couple more of these in docstrings below)

```suggestion
/-- Permuting the columns does not change the permanent. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Permuting the rows does not change the permanent. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Transposing a matrix preserves the permanent. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If `n` has only one element, the permanent of an `n` by `n` matrix is just that element.
```

```suggestion
# Permanent of a matrix
```

```suggestion
* `Matrix.permanent`: the permanent of a square matrix, as a sum over permutations
```

```suggestion
This file defines the permanent of a matrix, `Matrix.permanent`, and some of its properties.
```

pullRequest.title: feat(LinearAlgebra/Matrix): Permanent
